meanings.definition: In a way that hinders progress or action.
meanings.sent1: She moved obstructively slow, delaying the project.
meanings.sent2: He spoke obstructively, preventing any agreement.
meanings.sent3: The turtle raced obstructively against the hare.
meanings.sent4: The traffic jam obstructively held up the entire city.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog obstructively obscured the view ahead.

meanings.sent1: The obstructively large rock blocked the path.
meanings.sent2: Her obstructively loud music disturbed the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The obstructively stubborn door refused to open.
meanings.sent4: The obstructively tangled wires were a nightmare to untangle.
meanings.sent5: The obstructively high wall seemed impossible to climb.
